label.text: Reforestation
An area in the Lakes District (north-west England) that was once a tree farm is to be replanted with native trees.
Ellie’s school is planning a trip to help with the replanting. Restoring native trees is sometimes called reforestation.
Ellie is doing some research on reforestation to present to her class before the trip.
Here are excerpts from three sources that she has found.
Source 1: A guide to reforestation
Source 3: Scientific magazine
Source 2: Native trees of the Lakes District

The steps of reforestation:
1. Identify the species of trees native to the area.
2. Plant between 10 and 30 different types of native trees.
3. Implement a yearly weeding program.
Native trees of the Lakes District

The term “reforestation” is problematic. The point is to restore the entire ecosystem not just plant some trees. Simply put, we need the right trees in the right places to create an environment where even more native plants will begin to grow.
Ellie has reviewed all of her research.
She wants to make a list of 10 different species of trees that would be suitable to plant.
